channel.title: Microsoft workers celebrate Windows Phone 7 RTM with iPhone and BB hearses
channel.description:
[img]http://www.neowin.net/images/galleries/649/iphonecelebrationhearst.jpg[/img] Microsoft workers celebrated the release to manufacturing of Windows Phone 7 by parading through their Redmond campus on Friday with iPhone and BlackBerry hearses. Employees dressed up in fancy dress and also modified cars to include Windows Phone branding. Aside from the crazy outfits the workers made fake hearses for giant BlackBerry and iPhone devices. Employees cheekily claimed they had buried the competition with Windows Phone 7. Microsoft finished Windows Phone 7 on September 1 and plans to announce its release date at an open house event on October 11 in New York City. Windows Phone 7 is the most thoroughly tested mobile platform the folks at Redmond have ever shipped. According to Microsoft they had nearly ten thousand devices running automated tests daily, over a half million hours of active self-hosting use, over three and a half million hours of stress test passes, and eight and a half million hours of fully automated test passes. Microsoft has had thousands of independent software vendors and early adopters testing Windows Phone 7 and providing feedback. Windows Phone 7 is expected to be available in late October for those in Europe and November for those in the US. If you're interested in more about Windows Phone 7 then please see our in-depth preview.
http://www.neowin.net/news/microsoft-workers-celebrated-windows-phone-7-rtm-with-iphone-hearses Pretty good..

@XxKanexX wrote:

Why do they always do the retarded dancing? Do they think It makes them look fun and creative?
Oh dear.

item.title: Microsoft workers celebrate Windows Phone 7 RTM with iPhone and BB hearses
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Unhandled:

To be honest, the only thing this prevents is porting an existing native app to WP7.

Like firefox. It’s still a bad move.

item.source: Microsoft workers celebrate Windows Phone 7 RTM with iPhone and BB hearses

item.title: Microsoft workers celebrate Windows Phone 7 RTM with iPhone and BB hearses
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

They just haven’t released an SDK for writing native code for WP7 yet. You can still write and publish whatever applications you want using the managed SDK with the XNA and Silverlight APIs.

To be honest, the only thing this prevents is porting an existing native app to WP7. The .NET compact framework provides pretty much everything you need to write a new application.

Read full topic

Didn’t microsoft decide to dis-allow all third party applications on their phones? Seems to me that no matter how good the rest of it is, just that decision alone will destroy it.

[/quote]

http://developer.windowsphone.com/windows-phone-7/[/quote]

I got the idea from the article I linked to, obviously.
